result.execSummary:
The defendant Christel R. Jerome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Concurrent with: concurrent to current sentence

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christel R. Jerome appeared by phone means.
Court questions the defendant regarding her motion.  Defendant has no other arguments.
Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks the court to deny the motion.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the defendant's motion.
to Court from Christel R Jerome
to Court from Christel Jerome
for Sentence Modification
Motion hearing on August 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christel R. Jerome
Current: PO Box 220, Wisconsin Resource Center, Winnebago, WI 54985 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2017)
Prior: 1630 Apricot St., Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Christel R. Jerome in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Christel R. Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there are also consolidated charges from Wood County and also 14CF54 was dismissed but read-in for sentencing.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI.  Court received a copy of the PSI.  Atty Kryshak agrees and has no changes.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, Wood County case and Ct. 2 Marquette County case:  Court orders 11 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 7 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to her current sentence
*Eligible for Challange Incarceration Program
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 5 years has been served
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Court Costs = $268.00 on each count
Credit = 20 days


  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Statement on Read-ins

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Rights for consolidation
WOOD COUNTY
Sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Christel R. Jerome in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Christel R. Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CT54 & 14CF55 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there is a consolidation with Wood County and an amended information will be filed.  Atty Kryshak states that he has filed the consolidation paperwork with the court.
Court states that the consent forms were received by the Court from Wood County case #14CF242 for consolidation.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the consolidation and accepts the amended information.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Wood County case 14CF242 and Ct. 1 in 14CF55.  14CF54 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Kryshak agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Atty Kryshak states that the parties are requesting a PSI.  Atty Hendee agrees.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Wood County case 14CF242 and Ct. 1 in 14CF55.  14CF54 to be dismissed and read-in.
PSI ordered.
Set for Sentencing.
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christel R Jerome in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Christel R Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF54 & 14CF55:
Atty Kryshak states that the defendant will be waiving the Preliminary Hearing in both cases.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and waives the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christel R Jerome in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Defendant Christel R Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF54 & 14CF55:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint's in both matters & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow requests a Preliminary Hearing.
Atty Hendee does not object to a signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Corey Jerome except for in writing while in custody.
Atty Zamzow has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Corey Jerome except for in writing while in custody.
*Bond covers both 14CF54 & 14CF55

Atty Zamzow does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
